@MikuCat_Vtuber A subathon is when you set up a time period to get a certain amount of subs. You usually want to make goals for new subs so everytime you meet a milestone you have to do something. Examples: 50 subs: play an erp game 100 subs: erp with chat 200 subs: ntr chat  Just examples ofc
@rx_terra @MikuCat_Vtuber The goals usually involve doing something for the chat/subs... Trying to think of some incentives I've seen and can't right now, I tend to not watch those kind of streams. All the ones I've jumped into felt very pandering.
@Cattokye local vtuber says ''onii-chan'' per chat request 
@MikuCat_Vtuber Subathon is where you hold a long stream and try to get as many subscribers, not followers, as possible. you also have certain goals in place to see if people will pass them.

She's no stranger to flame wars either, having started many herself -- her current Twitter account is already her third as her first two were suspended. However, it's exactly this polarizing personality that draws in so many to her.   #VTuber 
Despite being an entirely independent VTuber, she sits above many, with close to 100k subscribers. Her blunt (tactless?) talk draws a strong, dedicated fanbase, many of whom donate large sums via superchat.  #VTuber 
Mea is well known for her raw speech on and off streams and videos, sometimes outright telling her viewers to give her money and fuck themselves. Then she tells them they're crazy for giving her money in the first place. And her fans love it.   #VTuber 
While a majority of the videos uploaded are anime and vocaloid-centric covers, there are also a few streams for special occassions, such as their first anniversary celebration. They don't update as often as other VTubers but they've definitely got some talent!  #VTuber 
Lara has a gentler voice which makes her suited to slower ballads -- not that it stops her from singing well for more intense songs. Mikoto's slightly nasal, higher pitched voice has a bit more strength behind it and carries her well through powerful songs.   #VTuber 
The Utagoe Housoubu Project began last September 2018, with Otohane Lara as its primary driver. Haruka Mikoto joined earlier this June 2019, with Mihaku Yukko joining as well (though she has yet to have her own videos). As you can expect, they're VSingers as well.  #VTuber 
She also just recently celebrated hitting 45000 subscribers a few hours ago (and is already in fact at 50,000 subscribers) with a 2-day acoustic live stream! You can find day 1 here→  and day 2 tomorrow. Have a look if you enjoy her covers!  #VTuber 
Having been active since last July 2018, she has covered numerous songs, but she is perhaps most well-known for her strong voice, lending impact to her many power vocal covers. But apart from covering songs, she streams games once in a while (though not so much lately).   #VTuber

I’ve been brutalized again this morning, but finally I’m finished! I kinda messed up on the hair honestly. I am EXTREMELY sorry if I messed this up. (T~T) #rinasobigallery #Rinasobi #Vtuber 
I am now unsure for what to do with all the assets. I can't just throw them away because deep down I really wanted this to materialize into something. But I also realized that vtuber market is really huge, and indie vtuber with no connection like me wouldn't stand a chance.
Lastly, due to my introverted nature, I don't have a connection to someone who would want to VA the vtuber. This was the biggest roadblock, I can't just use a voice changer to disguise myself as an anime girl!  Oh here's the result if I did so. 
Real talk: I have always wanted to produce my own VTuber for quite a while. But I keep doubting my ability to do it and just stopped halfway, even though I've already poured stupid amount of money and time to the project.  Here's a glimpse of what could have been.

Pro-tip on making a dent in backlog of VTuber archive videos: open the video URL in VLC, which allows you to watch the video at speeds above x2.  Works with YouTube and Twitch.  Use + on numpad to get speeds above x4.  The faster is playback speed, the faster dl speed required.

@Xythar @aquariistrike It's part of the reason why some corporate VTubers can often feel different: because thy are more of an actor playing a character. The key appeal of a VTuber is a grain of genuine individuality, even if the VTuber specializes in scripted skits or sketch comedy, for example.
@Xythar @aquariistrike Changing the person behind the mask has a greater impact than, say, changing a character's VA for a new season of anime/new game in a franchise. A fictional character can be made with things from a real actor. A VTuber is a real person in a fictional shell, if that makes sense.
@Xythar @aquariistrike I beg to differ. I think it's not entirely correct to call it "downplaying the involvement", or that "the entire character is built as CG". Like any YTuber, a VTuber thrives on their personality. The V part of Vtuber is just a medium that addresses a specific complicated issue:

One of the bigger mistakes, I think, is thinking that this #Vtuber thing is an advanced form of (3D) animation.  It's not. With the complete move to real-time production, it more follows the concepts of puppetry, and digital puppetry.  #SIGGRAPH2019
In light of #SIGGRAPH2019 and all the presentations about #Vtuber and the #WorldVTuberShowcase there, I'd like to reshare this poster I made a while back.  It's a rough history on what I believe had to come together to create this Digital Avatar culture.
